content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: The figure presents two measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps and the time signature is 4/4.
The figure presents two measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps and the time signature is 4/4.
The figure presents two measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps and the time signature is 4/4.
The figure presents two measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps and the time signature is 4/4.

content.answer: The figure presents two measures of music in treble clef. The key signature has two sharps and the time signature is 4/4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
